intro: Rytigynia bridsoniae subsp. kahuzica, commonly known as the Kahuzi rytigynia, is a rare and endemic plant species found in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded habitats within montane forests.
